intro: Isocoma veneta var. furfuracea, commonly known as the hairy goldenbush, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its densely hairy foliage and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
